qas.question: Who was attacking the Partisans in 1943?
From whom did Allied leaders switch their support from to Tito?
Who was the Soviet Premier who recognized Tito?
At what event was Tito recognized by Stalin?
When was the Balkan air force formed?

context: After the Partisans managed to endure and avoid these intense <a0_0>Axis<a0_0/> attacks between January and June 1943, and the extent of Chetnik collaboration became evident, Allied leaders switched their support from <a1_0>Draža Mihailović<a1_0/> to Tito. King Peter II, American President Franklin Roosevelt and British Prime Minister Winston Churchill joined Soviet Premier Joseph <a2_0>Stalin<a2_0/> in officially recognising Tito and the Partisans at the <a3_0>Tehran Conference<a3_0/>. This resulted in Allied aid being parachuted behind Axis lines to assist the Partisans. On 17 June 1944 on the Dalmatian island of Vis, the Treaty of Vis (Viški sporazum) was signed in an attempt to merge Tito's government (the AVNOJ) with the government in exile of King Peter II. The Balkan Air Force was formed in June <a4_0>1944<a4_0/> to control operations that were mainly aimed at aiding his forces.
